website_summaries.verdict: A very solid choice on a budget, but seat doesn't swivel or slide.
pros: Arms and back help eliminate slips and falls
Very lightweight unit and the price is right, too
cons: Doesn't swivel or slide, so not ideal for people who have severely limited mobility

customer_reviews.title: Beware.  Legs buckled causing nasty fall!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this well reviewed chair for my husband who has a progressive neurological disease. At first he used it in the shower just for additional stability as he was standing. In recent weeks, he starting sitting on it to wash his hair. After using it to sit on only a few times, the back legs buckled, causing a ugly fall in the tile shower. The chair is rated for 300#, but my husband only weighs 185. Stability has to include the integrity of the materials used. Clearly this could have been much more serious than some scrapes and bruises.
customer_reviews.author: GJC

customer_reviews.title: Mother is well within the recommended weight limit of 275 pounds
customer_reviews.text: One of the support legs broke and collapsed while my 85-year old mother was showering, while under supervision. She was injured as a result of the buckling of the chair leg. Mother is well within the recommended weight limit of 275 pounds, so the logical explanation is that the chair was defective. When I attempted to return this item, I was told it was no longer eligible for return. We purchased this January 17, 2016.
customer_reviews.author: VAElzes

customer_reviews.title: I could not install the left side arm rest due ...

customer_reviews.title: I have bad knees, going to get knee replacement
customer_reviews.text: I need a knee replacement / Wonderful for pain reduction in the shower. Highly professional company. I bought one for a friend as a gift, it did not fit. Womnderful gifr for a loved one you want to help reduce risk of a fall.

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier every day
customer_reviews.text: I would give this chair six stars if I could. My husband has Parkinson's Disease, which makes grooming challenging. We have two of these chairs, one in the shower and one outside, since he can stand only briefly. The chairs are stable and sturdy enough that he is safe using them to maneuver and push up on to stand, and they are light enough that I can move them easily. They don't rust or mildew, and they are simple to clean. I am thankful for them--and to the people who designed and built them--every day.

customer_reviews.title: Shower Chair for Mom

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell about the sturdiness.

One corner of the box was mash and the leg on the chair was slightly bent in. Was able to pull it back in place with some effort, but everything then fit together right. Just hoping the leg doesn't try to bend back in.

customer_reviews.text: Good solid platform. After no longer needed in shower I use it in yard and garage.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Also the arms are removable so it's easy to transfer in and out of from the side
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new one, works. This design works well in most showers and doesn't spill water outside the shower. Also the arms are removable so it's easy to transfer in and out of from the side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good bath seat
customer_reviews.text: I really like the adjustable legs and having arms. It was very easy to assemble and it is easy to adjust. My old bath chair had neither feature. My only concern is that it is pretty light weight but then it's easy to move. Time will tell if it will be durable but very satisfied right now.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting something like a suction cup foot
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and has been very helpful in my recovery. Only drawback is that the foot pads slide in the shower just a little, I was expecting something like a suction cup foot, that would stay put, however it has not been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gene M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy to assemble. No tools required. Very sturdy, very lightweight, excellent quality. Perfect fit in our walk-in shower. Not sure it would fit in a bathtub / shower though?
customer_reviews.author: cycorider

customer_reviews.title: NOVA bath chair
customer_reviews.text: Excellent chair for physically impaired. Helps in the shower very much.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M. Cook

customer_reviews.title: I trusted this for my family member.. and it is one of the ones I like (the family member and the chair).
customer_reviews.text: This chair was purchased for a 72 year old with hip problems. I placed this into 2 different shower types so far and have not seen even an inch of slipping. This has worked great for me for both fiberglass tubs and ceramic tile showers. You can easily remove one arm of you need to change the configuration for any reason.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Decent chair
customer_reviews.text: It works as intended. Stable and light weight. Good pads on bottom of legs
customer_reviews.author: Working Class Family

customer_reviews.title: VERY PLEASED!
customer_reviews.text: Very Sturdy! Which is important my Grandpa is 92 and 6' 1" tall so the short shower chairs did not work. It is nice having the handles so that he has something to help him push himself up after showering. Plus the grips at the bottom are very nice at keeping the chair from sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: Lana S.

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid bath seat
customer_reviews.text: We were able to assemble it easily without any tools. It's sturdy and solid. Unfortunately the indentations in the seat are not holes that go all the way through, which means the seat doesn't drain. That's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Zootie

customer_reviews.title: A very sturdy bath seat that is remarkably light weight
customer_reviews.text: A very sturdy bath seat that is remarkably light weight. Being able to adjust the length of the chair legs made showering so much better as I am tall. Being able to support myself on the arms to sit or stand was so helpful (I with a broken leg in a cast).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: SHOWERING MADE EASY
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 90 year old Mother- in- law. It fit perfectly in her full size shower and works particularly well in conjunction with hand held shower head. She has a bad back and fears slipping. This has made showering much easier for her. I would not recommend this for a very small stall shower but, it's great for bathtub or full size shower.
customer_reviews.author: JF Napa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and sturdy. but light and easy to move about as needed. Large seating area, with handles. Seems the best you can do for such a product.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair.
customer_reviews.text: My disabled relative finds this very helpful. Sturdy and well balanced to support weight, yet lightweight enough to be moved by someone with limited strength and mobility. Fits well within standard bathtub. Very easy assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene King

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy to put together! Very sturdy! Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: h

customer_reviews.title: Nice Utility Chair
customer_reviews.text: Our primary use of this chair for my husband , who has suffered a stroke, is in the shower. With it, he is able to function alone. But, because of the adjustable height and the arm rests, it is useful in other situations, too. These make it easy for him to sit and stand. For example, we use it when he is being shaved or having his hair cut. It is a good thing!
customer_reviews.author: Jo from Texas

customer_reviews.title: The sower chair that totally met our expectations.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the shower chair we needed. It is sturdy and the drainage holes are not apparent to the body while sitting in the chair. It is wide enough to accommodate our bottoms.
customer_reviews.author: BubbieRoz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble in minutes.fits snuggly in my tub so I can sit and shower or stand and use the arms for support I have had a knee and a hip replacement and this bath seat is so great!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe, durable chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy and well made chair. Easy to adjust the height of it. My dad likes that there are handles on either side. He feels more secure with it in the shower. I'm glad I bought it for him. The rubber feet prevent it from sliding or moving.
customer_reviews.author: weezie8101076
